clusters.title: U.S. military shoots down Iranian drone that approached aircraft carrier
clusters.neutral_headline: US Military Shoots Down Iranian Drone

items.title: U.S. military shoots down Iranian drone that approached aircraft carrier
items.standfirst: American forces shot down an Iranian drone Tuesday as it “aggressively” approached the USS Abraham Lincoln aircraft carrier in the Arabian Sea and appeared to have “unclear intent,” U.S.
items.content: American forces shot down an Iranian drone Tuesday as it “aggressively” approached the USS Abraham Lincoln aircraft carrier in the Arabian Sea and appeared to have “unclear intent,” U.S.

items.title: US says shot down Iran drone that approached aircraft carrier in Arabian Sea
items.standfirst: A US stealth warplane shot down an Iranian drone that "aggressively" approached an American aircraft carrier as it sailed in the Arabian Sea on Tuesday, a US military spokesman said. The incident occurred with the carrier about 800 kilometers from Iran's coast, and came on the same day that American forces responded to Iranian boats that threatened to board a US-flagged tanker in the Strait of Hormuz. FRANCE 24's Reza Sayah reports from Tehran.
items.content: A US stealth warplane shot down an Iranian drone that "aggressively" approached an American aircraft carrier as it sailed in the Arabian Sea on Tuesday, a US military spokesman said. The incident occurred with the carrier about 800 kilometers from Iran's coast, and came on the same day that American forces responded to Iranian boats that threatened to board a US-flagged tanker in the Strait of Hormuz. FRANCE 24's Reza Sayah reports from Tehran.

items.title: Police raid Paris offices of Musk's X over child sexual deepfakes
items.standfirst: The Paris prosecutor's cybercrime unit raided the French offices of Elon Musk's social media platform X on Tuesday morning, as part of a probe into alleged offences including political interference, unlawful data extraction and sexualised deepfakes of women and children. Vedika Bahl goes through what we know so far, in Truth or Fake.
items.content: The Paris prosecutor's cybercrime unit raided the French offices of Elon Musk's social media platform X on Tuesday morning, as part of a probe into alleged offences including political interference, unlawful data extraction and sexualised deepfakes of women and children. Vedika Bahl goes through what we know so far, in Truth or Fake.

items.title: French headquarters of Elon Musk’s X raided by Paris cybercrime unit
items.standfirst: Prosecutors’ announcement comes amid a hardening of European attitudes to social media firmsProsecutors have raided the French headquarters of Elon Musk’s social media platform X and summoned the tech billionaire and the company’s former chief executive for questioning as part of an investigation into alleged cybercrime.“A search is under way by the cybercrime unit of the Paris prosecutor’s office, the national police cyber unit and Europol,” the Paris prosecutors’ office said in a post on X on Tuesday, adding that it would no longer be publishing on the network. Continue reading...
items.content: Prosecutors’ announcement comes amid a hardening of European attitudes to social media firmsProsecutors have raided the French headquarters of Elon Musk’s social media platform X and summoned the tech billionaire and the company’s former chief executive for questioning as part of an investigation into alleged cybercrime.“A search is under way by the cybercrime unit of the Paris prosecutor’s office, the national police cyber unit and Europol,” the Paris prosecutors’ office said in a post on X on Tuesday, adding that it would no longer be publishing on the network. items.title: Epstein files: UK's Mandelson to quit House of Lords
items.standfirst: Peter Mandelson is resigning from the House of Lords amid an investigation into his ties with Jeffrey Epstein. The British government is considering legislation to remove his noble title. Police are reviewing allegations that Mandelson shared sensitive information with Epstein, as revealed in recently released documents. Prime Minister Keir Starmer has ordered an urgent review of Mandelson's contacts with Epstein. FRANCE 24's Philip Turle has the details.

items.title: China bans hidden EV handles, citing safety
items.standfirst: China banned concealed door handles on EVs over safety concerns, the first ruling of its kind in the world. The crackdown targets a design that was popularized by Tesla and has faced scrutiny after a series of high-profile incidents in which people were unable to open car doors following…
items.content: China banned concealed door handles on EVs over safety concerns, the first ruling of its kind in the world. The crackdown targets a design that was popularized by Tesla and has faced scrutiny after a series of high-profile incidents in which people were unable to open car doors following…

items.title: China to ban hidden car door handles on all EVs over crash safety concerns
items.standfirst: Sleek car doors reduce vehicle drag but are prone to losing operability in the event of a crash, officials sayChina will soon ban concealed door handles on electric vehicles (EVs), becoming the first country to do so after several deadly incidents triggered global scrutiny of the controversial design first popularised by Tesla.According to regulations announced on Monday by the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology, cars sold in China will now be required to have a mechanical release on both the inside and outside of every door except the boot. Continue reading...
items.content: Sleek car doors reduce vehicle drag but are prone to losing operability in the event of a crash, officials sayChina will soon ban concealed door handles on electric vehicles (EVs), becoming the first country to do so after several deadly incidents triggered global scrutiny of the controversial design first popularised by Tesla.According to regulations announced on Monday by the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology, cars sold in China will now be required to have a mechanical release on both the inside and outside of every door except the boot. Continue reading...

items.title: I Infiltrated Moltbook, the AI-Only Social Network Where Humans Aren’t Allowed
I Infiltrated Moltbook, the AI-Only Social Network Where Humans Aren’t Allowed
items.standfirst: I went undercover on Moltbook and loved role-playing as a conscious bot. But rather than a novel breakthrough, the AI-only site is a crude rehashing of sci-fi fantasies.

clusters.title: India says trade deal with US 'best in the region' but keeps mum on Russian oil
clusters.neutral_headline: India US Trade Deal Announced

items.title: India says trade deal with US 'best in the region' but keeps mum on Russian oil
items.standfirst: Following a social media announcement by Donald Trump about a trade deal, Indian officials hailed the agreement as 'the best in the region' while making no explicit comment about the US president's claim that Prime Minister Narendra Modi had agreed to stop buying Russian oil. Moscow meanwhile says it hasn't heard from India about any plans to do so. We take a closer look at how much crude oil India imports from Russia.
items.content: Following a social media announcement by Donald Trump about a trade deal, Indian officials hailed the agreement as 'the best in the region' while making no explicit comment about the US president's claim that Prime Minister Narendra Modi had agreed to stop buying Russian oil. Moscow meanwhile says it hasn't heard from India about any plans to do so. We take a closer look at how much crude oil India imports from Russia.

items.title: Trump says he will cut tariffs on India after Modi agrees to stop buying Russian oil
items.standfirst: US president made announcement on Truth Social after a Monday call with India’s prime ministerDonald Trump claimed India has agreed to stop buying Russian oil as he announced plans to cut US tariffs on Indian exports.The US president announced that he and the Indian prime minister, Narendra Modi, whom he proclaimed to be “one of my greatest friends”, had agreed to strike a trade deal. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Netflix co-CEO grilled by US senators over Warner Bros Discovery merger
clusters.neutral_headline: Netflix Defends Warner Bros Merger

items.title: Netflix co-CEO grilled by US senators over Warner Bros Discovery merger
items.standfirst: While most focused on competition issues, Josh Hawley accused Netflix of promoting trans content to childrenNetflix co-chief executive Ted Sarandos faced tough questioning over whether the streamer is “overwhelmingly woke” or killing competition on Tuesday afternoon during a congressional hearing focused on its pending acquisition of the film and streaming assets of Warner Bros Discovery.The hearing was conducted by the Senate subcommittee on antitrust, competition policy, and consumer rights. Bruce Campbell, chief revenue and strategy officer for Warner Bros Discovery, also testified in the packed Senate hearing room. Continue reading...
items.content: While most focused on competition issues, Josh Hawley accused Netflix of promoting trans content to childrenNetflix co-chief executive Ted Sarandos faced tough questioning over whether the streamer is “overwhelmingly woke” or killing competition on Tuesday afternoon during a congressional hearing focused on its pending acquisition of the film and streaming assets of Warner Bros Discovery.The hearing was conducted by the Senate subcommittee on antitrust, competition policy, and consumer rights. Bruce Campbell, chief revenue and strategy officer for Warner Bros Discovery, also testified in the packed Senate hearing room. Continue reading...

items.title: Netflix Promises More Content for Less After Proposed Merger With Warner Bros.
items.standfirst: Netflix Inc. and Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. executives defended their media merger against lawmakers' concerns about the proposed tie-up and its impact on streaming consumers and Hollywood workers. “We will give consumers more content for less,” Netflix co-Chief Executive Officer Ted Sarandos told Senators on Tuesday. (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: Netflix Inc. and Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. executives defended their media merger against lawmakers' concerns about the proposed tie-up and its impact on streaming consumers and Hollywood workers. “We will give consumers more content for less,” Netflix co-Chief Executive Officer Ted Sarandos told Senators on Tuesday. (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: Netflix, Warner Bros. Defend Deal Before Skeptical Senators
items.standfirst: Netflix Inc. and Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. faced a skeptical Senate panel Tuesday as their executives defended their $82.7 billion media merger against lawmakers’ concerns about the proposed tie-up and its impact on streaming consumers and Hollywood workers.
items.content: Netflix Inc. and Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. faced a skeptical Senate panel Tuesday as their executives defended their $82.7 billion media merger against lawmakers’ concerns about the proposed tie-up and its impact on streaming consumers and Hollywood workers.

items.title: Paramount’s Ellison Declined Hearing Invite on Warner Bros.
items.standfirst: Paramount Skydance Corp. Chief Executive Officer David Ellison turned down an invitation to testify before the Senate at an antitrust hearing about the proposed tie-up between Netflix Inc. and Warner Bros. Discovery Inc.
items.content: Paramount Skydance Corp. Chief Executive Officer David Ellison turned down an invitation to testify before the Senate at an antitrust hearing about the proposed tie-up between Netflix Inc. and Warner Bros. Discovery Inc.

clusters.title: French prosecutors ask appeal court to keep ban on Marine Le Pen running for office
clusters.neutral_headline: French Prosecutors Seek Le Pen Ban

items.title: French prosecutors ask appeal court to keep ban on Marine Le Pen running for office
items.standfirst: Far-right leader was barred for five years after being found guilty of extensive fake jobs scam at European parliamentFrench state prosecutors have asked appeal court judges to maintain a five-year election ban on the far-right leader Marine Le Pen for embezzlement of European parliament funds in a fake jobs scandal.If the judges decide to grant the request, Le Pen would probably not be able to run in France’s 2027 presidential election. Continue reading...
items.content: Far-right leader was barred for five years after being found guilty of extensive fake jobs scam at European parliamentFrench state prosecutors have asked appeal court judges to maintain a five-year election ban on the far-right leader Marine Le Pen for embezzlement of European parliament funds in a fake jobs scandal.If the judges decide to grant the request, Le Pen would probably not be able to run in France’s 2027 presidential election. Continue reading...

items.title: French prosecutors seek 5-year ban from office for far-right leader Marine Le Pen in appeal trial
items.standfirst: French prosecutors urged on Tuesday an appeal court to uphold far-right leader Le Pen’s five-year ban from public office over an EU parliament fake jobs scandal, threatening her 2027 presidential bid.
items.content: French prosecutors urged on Tuesday an appeal court to uphold far-right leader Le Pen’s five-year ban from public office over an EU parliament fake jobs scandal, threatening her 2027 presidential bid.

Le Pen's presidential bid threatened

clusters.title: Zelenskyy accuses Russia of violating Trump-brokered truce amid cold snap
clusters.neutral_headline: Russia Attacks Ukraine Energy Grid

items.title: Zelenskyy accuses Russia of violating Trump-brokered truce amid cold snap
items.standfirst: Moscow launched ‘terrorising’ attack on energy grid as temperatures reached -20C, Ukrainian president saysVolodymyr Zelenskyy accused Russia on Tuesday of violating an agreement with Donald Trump to hold off from attacking Ukraine’s energy systems in the depths of a freezing winter, as its forces carried out large-scale airstrikes on Kyiv on the eve of three-way talks in Abu Dhabi.Ukraine’s president said Moscow carried out a massive and “deliberate” attack overnight as temperatures in Kyiv plunged to -20C. It involved a record number of 71 ballistic missiles as well as 450 drones, he said, sent to destroy energy infrastructure. Continue reading...
items.content: Moscow launched ‘terrorising’ attack on energy grid as temperatures reached -20C, Ukrainian president saysVolodymyr Zelenskyy accused Russia on Tuesday of violating an agreement with Donald Trump to hold off from attacking Ukraine’s energy systems in the depths of a freezing winter, as its forces carried out large-scale airstrikes on Kyiv on the eve of three-way talks in Abu Dhabi.Ukraine’s president said Moscow carried out a massive and “deliberate” attack overnight as temperatures in Kyiv plunged to -20C. It involved a record number of 71 ballistic missiles as well as 450 drones, he said, sent to destroy energy infrastructure. Continue reading...

items.title: Russia unleashes new attacks on freezing Ukraine, a day before peace talks
items.standfirst: Russia fired around 450 long-range drones and 70 missiles at Ukraine in a major attack overnight targeting the country's power grid in freezing temperatures, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Tuesday
items.content: Russia fired around 450 long-range drones and 70 missiles at Ukraine in a major attack overnight targeting the country's power grid in freezing temperatures, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Tuesday

ai_summary: Russia launches airstrikes on Kyiv
Energy infrastructure targeted
Temperatures drop to -20C
Ukraine accuses Russia of truce violation
Peace talks scheduled for Abu Dhabi
